abstract.p: Ken Johnson reviews The Magic City, a six-artist show at Brent Sikkema gallery (S)

block.p: Multiculturalism not as a bureaucratic program but as a kind of delirious pluralism animates ''The Magic City,'' a six-artist show selected by Trevor Schoonmaker. At either end of the main gallery space two of Barkley Hendricks's life-size full-figure portraits of urbane African-Americans rendered in a vivid Pop realist style preside like royalty. The rest of the show is given over to forms of surrealistic collage or assemblage. In his funny ''Panthers'' series, Tony Gray draws cartoons of stereotypical black radicals in the illustrated pages of old juvenile history books. Roberto Visani creates a funky, tragic marriage of European and African histories in roughly made guns ornamented by tribal decorations.

Multiculturalism not as a bureaucratic program but as a kind of delirious pluralism animates ''The Magic City,'' a six-artist show selected by Trevor Schoonmaker. At either end of the main gallery space two of Barkley Hendricks's life-size full-figure portraits of urbane African-Americans rendered in a vivid Pop realist style preside like royalty. The rest of the show is given over to forms of surrealistic collage or assemblage. In his funny ''Panthers'' series, Tony Gray draws cartoons of stereotypical black radicals in the illustrated pages of old juvenile history books. Roberto Visani creates a funky, tragic marriage of European and African histories in roughly made guns ornamented by tribal decorations.

In the rear gallery, Tim Evans's gaudy, neo-Pop canvases layer images of toys, ethnic artifacts and morphing pornographic figures, while Rina Banerjee uses foam rubber, yellow Saran wrap, netting and other found junk to create a sprawling update of the Arabian Nights story of the lamp and the genie. In the middle space, Wangechi Mutu offers puzzling, possibly incantational works, like an inverted bottle dripping blue liquid onto the floor and a small, hypnotic video projection called ''Fate Smuggler.''
